intro: Gochnatia fascicularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Gochnatia fascicularis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
